etymologies: early 17th century: from Latin physiologia (perhaps via French), from Greek phusiologia ‘natural philosophy’(see physio-, -logy)

definitions: the branch of biology that deals with the normal functions of living organisms and their parts.
shortDefinitions: branch of biology that deals with normal functions of living organisms

definitions: the way in which a living organism or bodily part functions
shortDefinitions: way in which living organism or bodily part functions
